description.narrative: The project development objective is to support the Municipal Government's education strategy, by (i) increasing access to secondary education for adolescents and young people and improving their permanence in the education system; (ii) improving quality and relevance of primary and secondary education; and (iii) strengthening the decentralized education management capacity of the Municipality ofLa Paz.

condition.narrative: Maintain a qualified team responsible for project implementation
Submit Project Reports covering semester periods

title.narrative: New, rehabilitated or reconstructed classrooms with furniture in about 12 improved school buildings

comment.narrative: 11 additional classrooms will be completed by March 31, 2013 (closing date of the Project). Making a total of 97 classrooms.

title.narrative: Study on roles and responsibilities in school maintenance

comment.narrative: As a result of the study, there is a formal regulation (Reglamento) for the education infrastructure maintainance, which is beingvalidated with the community (Juntas Escolares)

title.narrative: Students from grades 1, 2, 3 and 4 at secondary level enrolled in the Program for At-Risk Students

comment.narrative: This is the cumulative number of students that participated in the program in 2009, 2010 and 2011.

title.narrative: Establishment and operation of Center for High Performance functioning
Teachers, administrators, members of Juntas Escolares who have received training in civic values from those that have received a diploma in civic values and active citizenship
Strengthen the capacity for decentralized education management: School buildings with functioning management teams in La Paz
Classrooms built, and furnished in 7 completely reconstructed and expanded school buildings
Classrooms built and equipped with audiovisual or computer equipment
Teachers, principals and municipal staff who have received diplomas in civic values and active citizenship
Administrative offices constructed with furniture and equipment
Secondary school students between grades 3 and 6 who become involved in dialogues, classroom projects and movements related to civic values
School Improvement Plans prepared by trained school management committees and financed by the Project
Increase access: Increase in enrollment in secondary education in the 7 completely reconstructed school buildings financed by the Project

comment.narrative: Current data is as of March 8, 2013 and provided by the Municipality of La Paz system information.

title.narrative: Increase quality: Diminish the repetition rate in secondary education from 8.3% to 5.7%

comment.narrative: The MoE made adjustments to their data base last year, which had influence in the project indicators and revised this progressdataupward.

title.narrative: Increase quality: Increase the promotion rate in secondary education from 86.2% to 90.9%

comment.narrative: The MoE made adjustments to their data base last year, which had influence in the project indicators and revised this progressdatadownward.

title.narrative: Information management and monitoring system in place

actual.value: Information system operating and providing reliable information
